```
 ERROR    HTTPError: 400 Bad Request from https://upload.pypi.org/legacy/        
         '=?utf-8?b?RnJhbnogS2lyw6FseSA8...YWxsIDxhamJAdWVhLmFjLnVrPg==?=' is an
```

issue.title: [MNT] addressing failed v0.14.0 pypi upload

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR attempts to address the failed pypi upload for v0.14.0, fixes https://github.com/sktime/sktime/issues/3715.

My suspicion is that there is an interaction between `setup.py` and `pyproject.toml` in the email address fields.

* this PR removes personal email addresses from `pyproject.toml`
* in `setup.py`, replaces names of one author with "project developers", and emails with a hardcoded string `"info@sktime.org"`

Also adds instructions to the release process docs how to re-release in a case where the wheel upload fails.

body: any ideas what this is, @jorenham? Haven't seen it before, and Professor Google doesn't seem to help...
@fkiraly I'm guessing something with the email address in the `setup.py` or `pyproject.toml`,  but I can't seem to find anything at first glance

@fkiraly It might be easiest to merge the `author` and `author_email` in the `pyproject.toml` and `setup.py`, formatted like a `RFC-822 From: header`, as specified in: https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/specifications/core-metadata/#author-email
let's keep this open until we are sure it works...

> @fkiraly I'm guessing something with the email address in the setup.py or pyproject.toml, but I can't seem to find anything at first glance

I had the same guess, though I did sth slightly different. If that does not work, I will try your suggestion next, @jorenham.

Other guess: `sktime` still seems to run on the pypi account on one of the founders, @mloning, who isn't very active anymore.
Could it be that he forgot about this and changed his password, so it no longer agrees with the secret?

Although the wouldn't fit the message which spews something about UTF8.

my attempt at fix: https://github.com/sktime/sktime/pull/3718

current release run: https://github.com/sktime/sktime/actions/runs/3406687638

I was on the page you linked just 10min ago, and it isn't 100% clear to me how to change it and where.
